what: Data from the Access to Opportunities Project (AOP)
title: Data from the Access to Opportunities Project (AOP)
text: aopdata R package download data Access Opportunities Project (AOP). AOP research initiative led Institute Applied Economic Research (Ipea) aim study transport access opportunities Brazilian cities. aopdata package brings annual estimates access employment, health, education social protection services transport mode fine spatial resolution 20 largest cities Brazil. package also brings data spatial distribution population sex, race, income age, well distribution jobs, schools, health care facilities social assistance reference centers. Data 2017, 2018 2019 already available, cover accessibility estimates car active transport modes (walking cycling) 20 largest cities country, public transport 9 major cities. information AOP website.

title: Download accessibility estimates with population and land use data — read_access
text: city Character. city name three-letter abbreviation. city="", function returns data cities. mode Character. transport mode. Modes available include 'public_transport', 'bicycle', 'walk' (default). peak Logical. TRUE (default), returns accessibility estimates peak time, 6am 8am. FALSE, returns accessibility -peak, 2pm 4am. argument takes effect mode either car public_transport. year Numeric. year number YYYY format. Defaults 2019. geometry Logical. FALSE (default), returns regular data.table aop data. TRUE, returns sf data.frame simple feature geometry spatial hexagonal grid H3. See details read_grid. showProgress Logical. Defaults TRUE display progress bar.

Access Land use data sets now cover years 2017, 2018 2019 Data Goiania now covers entire metro area Goiania 2019. Access data now bring accessibility estimates car 2019 Land use access data now bring data centers social assistance (CRAS) Population data sets minor spatial corrections smooth spatial distributions Minor changes read_ functions now default value city parameter.
